So, now we have the first roughly earth-sized planet, Kepler-78b, but with an orbital period of 8.5 hours and an sma of just 1.5 million kilometres, it isn't the most habitable place out there.

http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-24748601

It can't be long now until we find the first earth-sized planet in the habitable zone.
Had been fun with an small planet, Minmus to Bop sized in an orbit very close to Kerbol. For added challenge give it an serious axial tilt.

it isn't the most habitable place out there.

Yeah. Christmas every 8.5 hours. Oh the horror.
